page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Area lies to the south of Coventry, comprising undulating land drained by the River Sowe and Finham Brook. It has a long history with evidence of Saxon and Roman occupation. Lunt Fort is a Roman site but the Saxon burial ground is no longer in existence. The farmland was once large estates, but in recent years great pressure has been put on the land and farms have been divided and converted to other uses, such as Coventry Civic airport, sewage works and housing estates. Baginton village an historic settlement is now a dormitory town for Coventry. In many ways it is a typical rurban area, that is a rural area greatly influenced by the nearness of a large urban area.
